qas.question: Who was the winner of the 2014 Nobel prize in literature?
In what century did Collete, ANdre Gide and Francois Mauriac dominate the literary community?
In what city does Patrick Modiano live?
During what war did Modiano base most of his work off of?

context: In the <a1_0>20th<a1_0/> century, the Paris literary community was dominated by Colette, André Gide, François Mauriac, André Malraux, Albert Camus, and, after World War II, by Simone de Beauvoir and Jean-Paul Sartre; Between the wars it was the home of many important expatriate writers, including Ernest Hemingway, Samuel Beckett, and, in the 1970s, Milan Kundera. The winner of the 2014 Nobel Prize in Literature, <a0_0>Patrick Modiano<a0_0/>–who lives in <a2_0>Paris<a2_0/>–, based most of his literary work on the depiction of the city during <a3_0>World War II<a3_0/> and the 1960s-1970s.
